Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Samsquamch
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days. Small, simple room for those who want to spend their time exploring the city rather than staying in the room all day. Comfy bed, clean sheets and towel every day. More like a hostel than a proper hotel. Location is excellent. Transportation to everywhere nearby and lots of shops, pubs and restaurants. The underground can be a little noisy in the morning though. Will stay again if I am in London

Reviews.Title: “Good economical Christmas break”
Reviews.Author: Robert T
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights just after Christmas, London is so expensive that finding a budget hotel like this meant a good saving and therefore more money to be spent on enjoying yourself. Yes the hotel is somewhat dated but if you read the Hotel website I think a lot of people would agree that they do what they promise to do. Towels were changed and bathroom cleaned every day, fridge provided if you wanted to consume your own food. Breakfast is very basic Contiental, Tea/Coffee, Orange Squash and toast but again this is clearly stated on the website. If you are looking for a base to stay in London and dont want to many fancy frills I would say you could do worse than stay here, save your money for sightseeing and eating out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money!”
Reviews.Author: musicbox_85
Reviews.Content: Good location. Value for money. I took a triple sharing room and rates were really incredible! Breakfast was filling and service was prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not very clean”
Reviews.Author: smckek
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Aquarius because we knew what we were paying for, location. If you are just going to sleep here than this is not a bad option. If you desire a newer, modern establishment then the Aquarius is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Grimey hotel but clean bed sheets”
Reviews.Author: mightymags69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night last weekend, and my friend and I were very sceptical having seen other people's reviews. The man at reception was nice enough but our room wasn't signposted properly so we had to back and ask twice where it was. The room itself was on the lower level of the hotel, with a back door which we found wide open when we came to drop off our bags in the room. The bathroom didn't smell great but had been cleaned to a reasonable level. The shower wasn't clean enough for me to brave it without wearing crocs! And only very cheap soap was provided in terms of toiletries. There was also no where to hang clothes or a towel when in the shower. The beds were comfy enough and there were clean sheets on them, which was a massive relief. But the carpet was very stained and the general wear and tear of the hotel/room itself was very obvious. Trying to sleep at night was difficult, as the train goes by very close by, and is very noisy - as well as member of staff or other travellers banging doors around the building late at night. The "continental breakfast" was a complete joke. The orange juice was just cheap diluted stuff, and the only food offered is toast, butter and jam sachets. The hotel does not offer any form of drinking water outside of breakfast times - and the man at reception told us we shouldn't drink the bathroom tap water which was not very encouraging. We were very pleased to leave, I'm afraid to say!

Reviews.Title: “donÂ´t trust your frist impression”
Reviews.Author: snokie
Reviews.Content: this is really a tough one to rate. Finally I decided to rate with very good because: The location is perfect (for the price), the staff is very friendly and helpful, breakfast was also fine (many many toast, butter and marmelade), bedcover and pillows clean (did not smell bad). The mattresses were very good to sleep well. Actuall, yes there are some topics that are not perfect. Furniture is old, bathroom looks odd, underground passes by just behind the house but we could sleep easily anyway, we did not find any bugs, the fridge was clean and big, everything old but it worked, Laundery and everything you need just around the corner. It is the price. The price is unbeatable but you canÂ´t expext miracles for that. ThatÂ´s it. Would I come back ? Yes, likely.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: LordMikey01
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 6 times or more over the years. The rooms are about as small as possible for a bed, shower and loo, and the prices are the smallest in London. In fact you won't find many places anywhere in Europe or the US for that kind of money, plus they don't jack the prices up on certain days - it's the same price always. Cleanliness is adequate. Tea & coffee in room (unlike many European hotels), basic breakfast. Great location. When I stop in London all I want is a place to shower and sleep, and this hotel is ideal. My only complaint is the email booking system which is inconvenient and probably not secure.

Reviews.Title: “if you love bed bugs and cockroaches it's fine”
Reviews.Author: brownowl1960
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Aquarius a few times with no problem. This time however, my daughter woke me up at 2.30am to let me know there was something crawling across her bed. It was a bed bug. They then came out in force. The chap on reception said that he couldn't do anything about it that night, the hotel was full, but he would change our room the next day. I went back to the room and started to look on the net for somewhere else to go as the bugs just kept appearing. My daughter and I packed up and left the hotel at about 4.00am on the Thursday morning. On the way out of our room (number 18) we met a cockroach coming in. I understand that cockroaches eat bed bugs so it wasn't all that bad was it????!!!! I went back on Thursday morning to speak to the manager to have my money refunded. He didn't want to do so, insisting that it was a very clean place which was checked every month by pest control. What, for people paying Â£35-Â£55 per night in London? I don't think so!! I told him I was going to inform Environmental Health and he eventually paid up for the night we had "stayed" (which he complained left him short of a night's income) and following 3 nights for which we had booked. He was still not happy about it. Sorry, but I won't be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Dora01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with a bunch of class mates, but i wouldn't stay there if i were traveling alone or with a friend etc. There weren't any hot water in the shower, the barthroom was dirty and the breakfast wasn't anything special (Toast, tea and juice). But i didn't have any problems faling asleep even though the underground was right outside. The location is also very good: A 2 min. walk from Earls Court st. I know it's cheap, but i have lived in cheaper with better facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from it!”
Reviews.Author: MilenP
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three-night stay there. The only good thing about the Aquarius is the great location - a minute walk from Earl's court station, loads of shops, restaurants, cafes and pubs right next to it. Stayed on the first floor - right opposite the reception desk...the underground running just under the room, so if you want to sleep you have to get either exhausted or drunk.... Not that clean either..... Staff definitely NOT friendly Dining room cramped and always packed.... you have to wait at the staircase unless you go down for breakfast at 7.50.... Worst thing is that I found 2 packs of cigarettes missing from my baggage. Been to a dozen countries in Europe and Asia, stayed in dozens of hotels and such thing had never happened to me...It is hard to believe it but it's a fact. Never though I'd have things stolen from my bag.... Yeah, I know it's cheap, but if that includes personal items missing, no thanks, I'll never go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Really, really bad!”
Reviews.Author: Al_Traveller_9
Reviews.Content: I can NOT understand how some of the reviews here say that the rooms in this hotel are clean!!! Unless we were very unlucky and got the worst room in the hotel, believe me, the rooms are not clean! The carpet was filthy, the walls were stained, the toilet was mouldy, the bedspread was dirty! There was a cockroach in the toilet. I know it's very affordable and the location is great but it's not worth it, believe me! I'd rather pay a bit more and sleep in a clean comfortable bed. Plus: too noisy, the water was either too cold or too hot; there were no window shades and the room was tiny!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: kateGippsland
Reviews.Content: From Australia we had already booked then read bad reviews but were pleasantly surprised. Own shower and toilet, clean towels daily, refrigerator in room etc. Very obliging friendly staff. Breakfast is toast fruit drink and tea coffee etc but you can have cereal yoghurt etc before you go if you get organised. This Hotel saved us many dollars travelling on a tight budget. If not happy pay more and stay else where what can you expect for this cost in a city like London? Beats camping!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mithras_9
Reviews.Content: For Â£35 a night in central London I think that this is a real bargain. It is basic, certainly, but it is clean, warm and very well situated. The breakfast too was basic - tea, toast and orange (squash!) but I have no complaints and will certainly be going back in the future; I have also stayed it its sister hotel in Chiswick and my comments are the same.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel in london!”
Reviews.Author: The_Good_Jack
Reviews.Content: Very dirty! unfriendly staff, bad breakfast, without elevator, really small rooms... the worst thing: lots of bugs and ticks everywhere, disgusting! A real nightmare. The only good thing is the location. I wouldn't suggest it even to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be going back”
Reviews.Author: pj-in-germany
Reviews.Content: Ufrendly, unhelpfull, canclled resevation without notice ( E-Mail to wrong address ).

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Ross&Sarah
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in a rush as needed somewhere to stay after the Oasis gig in Wembley and there were not many hotel rooms left within my budget. Obviously when you pay Â£50 for a room for one night in London you don't expect the earth, but I do expect a clean, safe room. When we arrived we had to ring a bell for the receptionist, who kind of grunted at us and pointed at breakfast and check out times. not great customer service. We had room 1 which was opposite the dining room, and I think directly over the tube line as I was awoken at about 5am with the sound of trains which continued every 10 mins... not great for a nights sleep. The main light from the ceiling had no shade and the electrics were exposed on the ceiling. the bathroom was mouldy and made me feel quite sick. there was a random grey wire coming out of the wall which was exposed. Overall this hotel was ABSOLUTLY DISGUSTING and there is no way I would ever stay there again. I didn't really want to stay this time unfortunatly we didn't have time to trek around london trying to find another alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Basic price, basic room, basically okay”
Reviews.Author: Little_Vegemite
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel and that is adequatelly reflected in the budget prices. Along with the central location the price is the biggest attraction for this hotel. We stayed in a basic double room which had a small double bed, a closet, fridge, tv and washbasin. Bathroom was outside the room and shared with other guests. The rooms are nothing fancy but they are clean, comfortable enough and cheap as chips for London. Tea/ instant coffee, toast and jam are included for breakfast. This is definately a cheap but cheerful place which will not be suitable for all travellers. If you want something a bit newer, more homely and still central, you'll need to pay alot more for it in London. Consider the price and your length of stay, we found it okay for our two nights but I know others who would have found it unbearable. Best for hardened travellers and backpackers.

Reviews.Title: “Srtay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzyella
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel...no way...it is a dump and a disaster waiting to happen. No mention of the flights of stairs, no lift...and no help from the front desk. Rooms are filthy..mold in the shower...fire extinguishers used a door stop. This place should be condemned and shut down..Please for your own safety and health do not stay there...the pictures are not what they seem..it is a fire trap and it could mean your life...

Reviews.Title: “absolutely NOT recommendable!!!disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: jorney
Reviews.Content: Simply disgusting!! My boyfriend and I had plans to stay there for 3 nights. We didn't expect much when we arrived as is was pretty cheap . All we wanted was a place to sleep and a clean(!) bathroom, but when we saw the room( just a few meters away from the tube, dirty, very uncomfortable atmosphere, unfrienly staff, let alone the bathhroom :-(!!!!!)we changed our plans very quickly! I mean after we left the so called "hotel" ( in Germany you would never get offered a place like this as a hotel!!)we went through London to find something else to stay for the night and we saw many youth hostels and hotels but none of those were as ugly as this!We would NEVER EVER come back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Horrible room”
Reviews.Author: J0lie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, never again! The twin room was horrible, very small & dark , old, dirty, shabby, no tea & coffee making facilities. There was a big damp patch on the wall & the carpet was grotty. The en-suite was even worse & the shower leaked leaving the floor wet all the time. The room smelt of smoke and the bed felt like the springs were poking through the matress. We were kept awake by the constant noise of the tube which seemed to run under the hotel or very close by. The continental breakfast consisted of dilute orange cordial, tea or coffee and a plate of toast, nothing else! Horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful?”
Reviews.Author: MalteseGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: When our coach stopped in front of the Aquarius, it looked good, just like the website. A nice converted Victorian house, I was led to believe. Well, the price was incredibly cheap, and since we were a group of guys who just wanted a place to sleep, it suited us well. The sheets were always clean, and the continental breakfast (coffee, tea, "orange juice", toast and a selection of jams and butter) was abundant enough, but the breakfast room, in the basement with no outside window, does little to whet your apetite. Overall the place is shabby, staff indifferent and businesslike and the rooms are cramped. Railway enthusiasts should have a field-day over here however, as the underground passes right behind the hotel, and some rooms have windows overlooking the track. Earl's Court is a busy station, and just staying in the bathrom, yuou will be subjected to the constand sounds of trains going about! On the positive side, it is very centrally located, with a two minutes walk to the Tube station. It is incredibly cheap, so highly recommended for backpackers and people who want a holiday in London on the cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Hovel. Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: JKEAT
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at this hotel I was greeted by a reception behind a glass pane - like a bank, as if I was trying to rob the place, not a great start. Next I was directed down to my basement room by rude impatient staff. It was cramped, stuffy and small enough to be most hotels bathroom. A winodw led out onto a yard of some sort, and since half the room was underground anyone could jump in if the window was left open. I did NOT feel safe here. The en suite bathroom and carpet were ridiculously dirty and the toilet was broken. Streaks of scum actually covered the shower wall and floor. It was disgusting. I've stayed in hostels before and this place made them look like 5 star accomodation. It couldn't have been worse.

HotelInfo.Name: Aquarius Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 20-22 Hogarth Road, London SW5 0PT, England
